catalog_info.title: Cultures of Commodity Production Across the Americas
catalog_info.description: This seminar uses social and cultural approaches to explore the history of Latin American and Caribbean commodity production, from silver to cocaine. Drawing on historical texts, poetry, fiction, and film (all translated into English), we will study the communities created by those who mined, planted, harvested, and labored in the region’s major export industries. This course challenges us to consider the socio-cultural implications of wider economic and trade processes.
